REVIEWS: Though it is android TV comes with pre-installed PRIME VIDEO and other Video apps, Prime video and other apps are getting crashed.  i have raised complaint to Amazon to troubleshoot the issue and their technician has reported that TV has issues without showing-up to my house . i've also contacted VU customer service, they said this model has issue. i really had bad experience with amazon service. the lesson i learnt is buy it from your local shops around you, instead of going through this hardship. Zero Star for their valuable service. i don't thing Amazon will post my review.

So, bought this TV during the recent Great Indian sale.1) This TV is apt for viewing distance of 10-15 feet - Comes with the wall mount.2) The picture quality and sound is actually good - Not attaching images as I am not good with photography.3) Pre-installed apps are working fine (Netflix/Zee5/Hotstar/the usual runners).4) Play store provides ample other options.What's not working:1) So, this probably is a Amazon Prime issue. I am not sure (need to call Amazon) but my Prime is not working. Like the device is registering to my account however when I try to play the video - I get a msg to go to amazon.com/videohelp. Which really is not helping. I can cast via my phone though so I guess, it's not a complete dead end.2) Phone mirroring works however lags by a few seconds.Overall, a must buy at the discounted price that I bought it - INR 18k.Final word, a big thank you to the installation team. Missed the first schedule (understandable during sale season) however, second run wasn't a Miss and the guy was good. No hassle and polite.
Nice as under 12k. Will update review and share once use for six months .as I seen it's required proper 4g speed which not available in india at all locations even in metro.

This tv is good sale if you get during great indian sale with exchange...bank discount ...with Amazon pay balance 1000 cashback....Everything is good ...only one thing missing is voice search....I have installed android remote control and connect with Bluetooth option..Google voice search works fine....

True Android TV running smoothly on Android 9.0.Pros -Total value for money, way ahead of Mi Tv or any other low budget buy in this price rangeAndroid 9.0 and all featured apps working like a charmDecent looks and premium remoteCons-Sound quality, picture clarity is slightly under par when compared to LGs, Sony, and Samsungs but hey you are paying way less for it.**Prime Videos were not working initially but after an OS update and restart, it is working seamlessly.

Honest Review.*Price- I got this with exchange and card discounts at 12k.. Without exchange u can het this around 17k.*Display - I am a marvel fan, i like to watch super heroes movies and this TV is a treat. Good clarity, color reproduction. No complaints from my end on this.. Yes i have observed that when we see from side closely we see little negative images maybe because of big screen to believe me this won't be a problem as i never had.. We see movies from from not from completely edge side of tv right..*Sound - Sound is decent don't expect to work like soundbar.. I had LG tv earlier and comparing that with this sound is 40% better louder and clear.. But if u wish to have home theatre experience get home theater..*Processor- To be honest i dont have any technical info on this but yes i download 1080p HD BluRay Movies in HEVC (Highly compress) format. My LG TV never read this format but this TV play smoothly without any glitches..  I have also downloaded MX player (as this is android tv).*Casting- Yes this is where i removed one star.. Casting need Internet connection unlike other Mi smart tv which works directly without Internet. Was very difficult for me to cast mobile to TV, at the end i used my mobile hot-spot to do so. This can be resolved with firestick (i had this earliesr to make my normal LG TV smart) or any other smart casting device which normally cost 1k. If anyone knows how to cast offline in this TV pls let me know.*Connectivity - No problem here.. It has Bluetooth, wifi, 3.5 jack, HDMI Arc.... Refer my screenshot..Conclusion : With this said i am happy with my android TV.. I get real Theater experience with big screen watching HD movies..You would get many reviews here but believe me there is nothing in this TV which may make u regret buying it..

Plain cheating by Vu - this TV does not support Prime Video and Netflix, although the apps come pre-loaded and the remote comes with dedicated buttons. Secondly, it's got an extremely slow processor. Even YouTube takes a lot of time to load. Lastly, it was a nightmare to return this TV. I must have spent several hours over one week with Amazon customer care, to finally get the return approved.Both Prime Video Customer Care as well as the Vu company's technicians told me that this TV wouldn't run Prime Video and Netflix. It's shocking that Vu is so blatantly misleading their online customers; equally shocking is the fact that Amazon is also not doing anything about it.
After updating software which VU sent process documents via email. Amazon prime is working.

Good but Amazon prime doesn't work with the inbuilt app. Also some inbuilt app force close themselves. Buggy software.Update: There was an update to the software. Amazon prime is working now. Good quality TV with super clarity and colour reproduction.

Amazing Build Quality ,picture and sound and software is a little bit messy at first because Amazon Prime will not work ,so what i did was contacted VU Technical Support and they have released an update of 852 mb.Now you should install that update and once again check Amazon Prime,if the problem persists you should factory reset your smart TV.This will automatically updates the old version to new version and Amazon prime will work Flawlessly.Google chromecast works fine nothing to worry about.casted a Amazon prime video (when inbuilt app was not working ) for about 3 hours without issueNeed to check Netflix and Kodi and keep you posted.

Avoid buying from amazonVu 43" ultra android tv is a good buy at 21k and value for money, the picture quality and sound quality are good at this price. Also it comes with stock Android 9. The only issue which I have faced is prime video not working properly (which resolved through an update by proactive support from vu customer care) though has separate option in remote and mentioned in offering. It also sometimes responds a bit slow to remote actions.Unless you are ok with spending hours explaining issues to Amazon customer care executives one after another don't buy it from amazon, supposedly there is a large appliance customer care team which, as per my experience, is pathetic. Sharing the issues I have faced so that you are well aware of challenges when you buy any large appliance from Amazon:Installation: The installation guy has not come at the scheduled slot with no information. I was supposed to keep waiting for him. Once the waiting time (1.5 hours) is over I had to spend 3 hours explaining the issue to Amazon customer care, with no resolution. Supposedly there are different teams and call will get transferred to different executives and keep waiting on music (you would be asked to receive a call back from chat executive) and explaining the issue again and again. Finally, they told me they are unable to help. Installation guy came to my place 10 days after the tv delivery.Warranty: Though there was free extended warranty from acko as per the offer when I bought the tv. I have not recieved any information regarding the same. I had  contacted Amazon customer care regarding the same and again faced the same pattern. After spending one hour ten mins explaining the issue to different executives I was asked to call again after few hours. Knowing the final response and the hastle I have to go though with Amazon large appliance customer care, I have decided to forget about the extended warranty. I believe a good number of frustrated customers may not follow up for warranty.

Ultra Android VU TV newly lauched is ultra bad. Remote has dedicated prime button but prime not supported. Google assistant app present in the TV...no voice support on remote. Service engineer has no knowledge. Unable to explain any features. TVS e service providers should train n update the engineers. 24*7 Amazon prime customer service is unable to resolve the issues. Overall don't buy. Atrocious buy.

Tv is with me, no installation from past 2 days. No proper timeline and response also.Now installation done.But coming to tv look and working, it’s simply awesome.  Prime also working after reset/update tv os. Cool tv and best budget in this price. Voice option remote could be better.

Well for starters the complete playstore is not available. I could not even find Google Chrome but yes the picture quality is excellent and the sound too has become quite good since my first Vu TV. Overall a very good buy. So what exactly did I do for it to work. Firstly stop all updates. Not even system update cause the screen just stays put and nothing gets installed. Next step was to start installing desirable apps & to me the first I needed was a file explorer & a browser I found in playstore by searching just those words. Once that was done I did a system update. Now I can run any App bit Prime Video.When I try to log in it says can't login register on Prime ideo/MyTV. When I give the hashkey provided it says registration successful but on seeing devices registered this TV won't be found. So basically a dead end. Casting is slow but you need to only cast prime video else everything else can be side loaded. That is search for the app on your phone and install it via USB using file explorer.Yes Thope TV, Oreo TV, Typhoon TV, etc will work seamlessly. So basically it is not so simple but once you do everything falls in place. Would I recommend it? Damn well I will for at this price you get an excellent screen, sound again is very good & almost any Android App can be installed. No not Jio TV. I can see only half the screen!Update...Well when folks from VuTv called for feedback I did tell them about the Amazon Prime issue. The caller noted it down and sent me a PDF file containing the solution. It was upgrading OS to a Sep release & doing a reset. Now I had installed Apps & was wary of doing a reset. Now they called again to check if I had done the update or needed help. I said I hadn't done but they said everything would be fine. So I did a reset and was able to login to Amazon Prime & it worked. Also the sluggishness of casting got solved.  So I am upgrading the rating to 5 stars from 4...
Thanks to the recent update, amazon prime app is working fine now, satisfied with the product.

Picture quality and sound quality is very good in this price range. Apps are working fine.Build and look is classy.Another master piece from VU brand.This is value for money deal as other brands smart tv are overpriced in this category.I bought this in sale so received good discount.This is my second review for TV.After my first review, VU customer care proactively contacted me and did the installation on committed date. So no problem with VU. Excellent service.I will add more detailed review after using TV for 2 months.But Amazon and VECare need to improve their service and professionalism.

Sound and pocture is very awesome. All apps is working fine like..youtube , netflex,primevedio.Even we can install external apps via Downloading apk in google crome.If anyone want to buy it go for it.

The amazon prime issue is solved by doing a factory reset of the tv. This Tv has decent build quality, picture quality and most of the features you would require factoring in the price you pay.However, what bothers me the most is the poor sound quality. It distorts with a jarring effect whenever there is any sound with bass in it, for example background music, loud noises etc. This happens not only on high volume but on low volume as well as well. The sound comes off as boxy and annoying. Have tried different sound setting as well but can't seem to resolve the issue. Not sure if this problem is being faced by everyone or for my tv alone hence am going to ask for a replacement.Update 1:The Technician that Amazon sent to check the TV has now confirmed that there is a functional problem with the sound of the TV and it needs to be replaced. However, after many phone calls with Amazon customer care they are now telling me that the option to replace the TV is not appearing in their backend system and there is only an option for initiating a refund.However, a refund is not the solution for me as the price for the same model has now gone up by 1500/- on Amazon (from the same seller, Cloudtail), so I can't repurchase the same model at the price I paid.All this while they were assuring me that the TV would be replaced if a fault was found but are now saying that they can only refund the amount paid as the TV is not in stock with the vendor. This is not true as it is still available on the Amazon site through the same vendor albeit at a higher price i.e. 19999/- (instead of 18499/-, which is the amount I paid for it).Since all of this is no fault of mine I do hope they are able to resolve this issue amicably without further delayUpdate 2:Finally received a replacement for the TV a few days back. But was suspicious as it did not come in the type of packaging as the first TV I received (no protective plastic covering on the outside of the box).  Once the technician opened the box to install the same we found out it was a used TV as there was no protective plastic covering the TV inside the box as well, the TV was just placed inside the box with the accessories. The remote batteries were already inside the remote and once the TV was switched on it went directly to the viewing screen without going through any setup.Add to all this the sound issue persisted in this TV as well so had no option but to return the same for a refund.Please be aware that Amazon is recirculating these TVs and hence their customers must make sure that they are infact receiving a new/unused piece.This has been one of the few times I've had a bad experience with Amazon but hopefully they look into the matter.

Extremely happy with the customer first approach taken by VU. Received a call from Prashanth (VU) and all the queries/issues were addressed. Besides, the performance of the TV is as per the expectation.The  Amazon Prime Video issue is also fixed now.

Be careful where you Buy it from, I purchased from cloudtail ltd And the follow up for installation was never ending.However when Vu got involved the matter was resolved very quickly.The product is good and user friendly takes 2 seconds to start up and change between apps but otherwise a lovely product.

But the wifi net should be high-speed to enjoy the High quality streaming.Overall a very best TV in this price.I give 4.5 star out of 5.

Update for my previous review:- Now all working fine. Need an option to select which should  open while switching on like HDMI port or Cable or To use internet .Quality of TV is good but it takes little bit more time while startup.

PROS:Picture Quality: Upscaling technology of of this TV is good. SD channels were quite decent. HD channels were great. Picture reproduction is a bit weird in few cases. Yellow appears orange. Picture quality is sharp and clear. You just need the setting correct. Enabled the PC/Game mode and motion blurred can be reduced to a great extent.Sound: Stereo sound is Loud and clear. However, beyond 25% volume, the sound cracks and not audible. Note, get your sound settings correct. You have a option to choose between 'stereo' sound and 'surround' sound. 'Stereo' is good for music whereas 'surround' is good for dialogues (movies/serials).Screen Cast: No lags. You will need to download 'Google Home' app. Offline content cannot be casted without a internet/Wifi though.Viewing angles: I viewed upto 45 degree angles, and it didnt disturb the picture qualityYoutube: Played excellently well. No lags at all. Music played in stereo sound setting were treat to my ears. The Bass effects are awesome.Boot time: TV restarts just under 15 secondsOTT apps: Works fine. No issuesCONS:Remote: No Bluetooth in remote, so you typing/searching is a pain. Downloading android TV remote app can partially take care of typing. You will need to carry 3 remotes (TV remote, DTH remote and Mobile remote app)Ultra HD: This is a Full HD TV (1k resolution), not Ultra HD (4k resolution). So if you are going to view this TV majorly for DTH channels and little bit of online contents, Full HD is sufficient.Overall, this is a decent Android TV, but sound cracks beyond 25% .

Purchased during recent Great Indian Sale (40 Inches),Pros:1.  Excellent Picture Quality with Full HD.2. Sound Quality is quite sufficient for a large living room.3. Wide viewing angle.4. 5 Start Power consumption.5. Most of the paid subscription Apps works after the initial firm ware upgrade.6. Built-in dedicated Keys helps in switching to apps with ease.Cons:1. Remote or TV doesn't support voice commands, requires an additional device.2. Typing with remote is a bit awkward, QWERTY keypad on remote would help a lot.

I'll address the Amazon PrimeVideo problem first and it's solution. Initially the registration of device was not happening it's a software issue.Solution: Update the TV software. Settings-Device Preferences-About-System update. After its done prime video will work for most but I had trouble even after update. Then I did a reset (last option in Device Preferences) and it solved my issue. Hope this will help others. Picture, Audio and overall performance is great and great value for money. The customer care side of VuTv needs improvement.

Gorgeous display, and sound quality is amazing too, but a proper soundbar or speakers should be purchased with this.initially was somewhat let down with the picture quality but putting some time in the settings menu and tweaking in the picture settings, the picture quality now looks absolute amazing, have completely cut off the cable and use streaming services to watch content here. installed many streaming apps like zee5 netflix amazon prime eros now, loving it.brought 43 inch and 32 inch for  my bedroom and office. best purchase decision.Did not had any problem while setting up Amazon Prime whatsoever.my advice go for it, play with picture quality settings a bit to get your desired results. and yes, if you plan to use the smart features of tv then get a proper broadband connection, initial setup takes time and there would a very important day one OTA update. make sure you have proper internet, otherwise experience could frustrating with the slower internet speeds.

This TV was delivered to me on 6th & on 9th Oct the installation was done. All good so far. Happy with the sound & picture quality. Most of the Apps are working fine including Netflix. However I have problems connecting to Amazon Prime. Tried several times, entered the Code from the TV to my Amazon login on my computer. I get a success message on the computer but nothing happens on the TV. Tried calling the Amazon toll free no. but no person to speak with. If someone can help me with this would be highly appreciated.Sorry for the late update. Finally a service guy came to check my TV. Sat from 10:30 until 13:30. Tried several things including some downloads and restarts with no positive result. Promised to get back to me in 2 days. I did not hear from him for 4 days. Then I got a call from Mumbai VU who asked me to do certain updates on the TV. I asked him to call back the next day as I would be near the TV. He did call the next day and finally Amazon Prime started working on 6th Nov. (27 days after the TV was delivered). But I was happy. Then 2 days later the technician who came to my office called to say hes coming to fix the problem. I told him it was already sorted. All is well so far with the TV and its a good buy for the price. Cheers.

LCD is getting cheaper day by day and I thought i was about to have yet another LCD tv but this surprised me quite a lot. I also own the sony edge lit KDL-55HX800 as well as shinco 49 inch backlit LCD 4k TV.Pros :* Blacks are deep and its good.* I was expecting bleeding around the edges but it was on par with sony in terms of it and there was zero bleeding around the edges.* Smart TV features works good as advertised* NETFLIX, PRIME tv works* Sound is decent although im using a hometheatre* Weightless remote control and convenient button placementsCons :* Initial setup with phone was poor ( if we select 5ghz wifi to connect to, then it will simply freeze. Although i blame google for it)* Sound adjustment can be better. Certain external speakers dont provide bass adjustment and it would be nice if i can adjust bass through the UI.* Its been months since 10 was released and im pretty sure it supports treble. So why the delay the update ( Although this seems to be an issue with most OEMs)
it's working fine, nice product,

It's too early to comment..Android being top cader on OS could improvised even better.. looking forward as future software upgradesTV is sleek and simpleOverall a good price for 40 inch models with other competitorsWill be sharing more detailed updates after usage ...As of now it's worth a buy
Best tv quality and amazon service

(2days usage)TV as such has everything working out of the box. Android smart it is ! with good audio (not excellent) and video quality .All streaming services app,playstore etc work as expected once you connect to internet and logins provided . Can't side load apps (i didn't find options yet ) . At this price range what you expect ;).*The biggest spoiler for VU is that Amazon handles the install services very poorly ,it took a week to get this installed (since DIY install void warranty) .At first it was Amazon app giving error to book slots,afterthat It takes 48+hrs fot site visit.*

Primevideo app started working only after a software upgrade by VU engineer. Netflix, youtube and hotstar are ok. Zee5 was also not working even after upgrade. After a day, update from google play store made the app work. Kodi also pre installed is still not working. Sunnxt installed from google play is ok. Hungama preinstalled is ok.

Purchased this VU tv after a month of all brands tv reviews consideration in December 2019...Worst part is1. Voice based search option not working2. If you're playing any videos from youtube?/ AP/Netflix after few seconds it stop automatically and display please scan channels..3. Some times no response and needs to restart...I felt happy for 19k but now I am beating with my slipper why did I choose such a worst product even though I know about Android programming and all...

The product is very good ... delivery was prompt by Amazon as usual !! The picture quality as well as sound quality is pretty good for the price and the Smart TV features work well !! The latest Android pie as the OS delivered a smooth experience, the TV remote is responsive and having direct buttons for Netflix, Prime Video, YouTube, Hotstar as well as Google Play helps immensely. Bluetooth connectivity is a boon for connecting wireless headphones etc, Casting your phone works pretty well ... etc. etc. Lot of good features that I found useful. I did compare many similar TV's before buying this one, and am not at all disappointed with my decision till date. I would have loved to have 3 HDMI connections, but that is only a minor miss I would say. This is not my main TV (that is a bigger and high-end TV) so I am not comparing the two, I have a fair understanding and appreciation of AV, hence in my judgement this is a very good TV at this price point (maybe better than some products at a little higher price points than this. I would recommend !!

5* for Amazon service, fast delivery, fast return and fast refund.Tv features good sound good picture quality good but defective piece as both corners have white lines. Not expecting such thing from California brand VU.I wanted exchange but amazon refunded money back.

I am happy with the Tv. Kindly do not mis-interpretate my review. The Tv takes time to load after starting. Which is completely  fine if I go by the point of view that it is a machine. However being a customer it could be pretty frustrating sometime. Maybe it can be fixed by an update, lets see what happens.As far as the voice recognition is in concern, Remote doesn't work with that, unsure whether that is meant to be in that way or not. Really hope that remote could be used for voice recognition.

(Jan 5)The a+ grade panel is quite decent. Comparable to an IPS display. Tinker around with the display and sound menu to get the best effect. The blacks when contrasted well look beautiful sometimes. Bezels are decently thin. Do not go with the presets. The processor inside is not the fastest, so expect a lag in navigation (but not in every app). Sound and display adjustments don't work inside the app. Btw, you can use the app, or use the cast feature (they are different features). Using the app usually gives you the highest quality possible. You can set it up in Google Home app as well. I recommend a soundbar with this although the speaker is quite loud. I have dts sound disabled now, will enable when i connect hdmi arc through a soundbar.You can use android remote app from google, works seamlessly. The tv remote is not a motion sensing one.Edit 1 (Jan 10) : Wall mounting done. Professional people. Added video recording of the tv paired to my JBL BAR CINEMA SB110. Took it from all angles possible.Hit the like button if this review was of any help.

POOR QUALITY Product !Calling it a poor quality product will be an UNDERSTATEMENT.Color quality, it's so slow, lags etc. This is what VU California is all about. Buying this is a WASTE of your hard earned money. Never recommend. This brand !

Amazing tv with unsatisfactory sound quality (especially at high level). Quality build. No button to activate google assistant via remote (although tv os has it and can be activated via google's remote app). Also no button to open settings directly via remote when u r watching something and need to change sound or picture quality, very irritating to pause & go back to home screen to access settings everytime. Reducing one star from original because company representative called me to give a good review here to get a 3 month additional warranty. Please VU don't get so low. Negative feedback gives u guys an opportunity to improve.

This review is edited after about a week of use. Good picture quality, decent sound quality. Best of all, excellent value for money esp with the exchange of my old TV. Earlier, I had Netflix, YouTube working fine but I had mentioned that Amazon Prime I wasn't able to sign in, due to some bug. I got an email from Vu detailing the procedure to ensure that Amazon Prime also works. I had to reset to default settings, but after that Amazon Prime has also started working. So all is fine nowThe delivery was on time, but the installation was delayed by about a week and took several follow ups. But was finally done well.
Good picture quality & fast installation

1 month review:All good as per the price.Picture quality is good, considering price.Sound is better than okay but not best, considering  price, it is good too.Remote control is not BT but IR, so you need to literally point it at the TV, like it used to be in earlier days.No issues with any app or linking any account on any streaming app as mentioned in other reviews. Thise issues might be there earlier but I haven't faced with any of the apps after 10-06-2020.Apps used - prime videos, netflix, zee5, hotsar, discover+,jioTV, airtelxstream, youtube, facebookwatch, sonyliv, jiocinema, aajtak.1 strange issue, probably not with the TV - prime videos enforce you to use the default profile, you cannot use any other profile.

The TV is competitively priced with attention to detail in design. An example is during the installation, I noticed that they have taken good care that in a case of wall mount, the mount does not damage the wall & hence some cushion has been provided along.The only which could be improved is the speed. I felt the TV was a bit slower as compared to my other TV although this does not affect the viewing experience & Hotstar takes a long time to load. I am not sure if this is specific to my TV but nothing major as well.Overall a good product in affordable price.I had issues with the installation from Amazon & after escalation, VU themselves made sure the TV is installed on time & checked with me if I am satisfied with the service. That is a really great after sales experience not so common across other brands I use. The person from VU who did the installation was also extremely good & had a good understanding with the installation.The Picture & sound quality is no doubt good for the price.Overall a very pleasant experience so far.
Totally satisfied with the product and service. Will recommend it.
All features are excellent and truly amazing .it is really worth for money compared to the others in the same category.Picture and sound quality is superb

vu smart tv best hain 12500 rs kay reng main,picture quality best hain,sound bhi acha hain ,wifi connection bhi perfect hain,jada time nahi leta connect hone main through hotspot of any device like mobile.cons-sirf ek cons hain( iska mirror cast function ko internet lagta hain) ,(play store main google home app hain uskey through aap mirror cast function use kar sakte ho,ye app say speed match hota hain video or sound ka ),aur mirrror cast kay liye internet speed jada chahiye,main jio 4g network use karta hu.kabhi kabhi aap tv main same mobile say wifi use kar rahe ho aap same mobile se mirror cast use karna chahate ho to connect nahi hota ,behtar hain aap do device use karo mirror cast kay liye.

Purchased this TV recently and feel it was a money well invested.Pros -1. Excellent picture and sound quality. Audio is quite loud.2. Good smart features.3. All necessary apps work well. (A note reg Amazon Prime, once you setup the TV it will update itself. After that do a reset and setup again. The app will work as expected.)4. Great features overall. Bluetooth, Android remote, media player and chromecast work like a charm.5. Sleek and matte black color gives a good look. The bezels are sleek and non reflective.6. All required connectivity options and ports are present.7. Quite lightweight for it's size and company also provides the wall mounts which one has to buy separately otherwise.8. The technician was excellent and completed the installation on time and answered all queries patiently.9. TV is responsive for the most part. Boot time is also good.10. Remote is easy to use and has shortcut buttons for most used contents.Cons -1. Viewing angle could have been better.2. No option to change video/audio settings while watching something. You have to exit the app and do the changes.3. The TV lags a little sometimes but only momentarily.4. No option for voice control in the remote given. The TV supports it and can be used via your mobile phone through android remote app.5. Only concern is the RAM and how it effects the performance of the TV in days to come.

I was going to buy a premium android tv but then opted for this because it's FHD and not 4k.. Most of the people would go for 4k without knowing that in India TV channels are still being broadcasted at FHD that is if you own FHD channels pack.. Else it's WVGA(480p).. Though VU has a great upscaling quality you will still loose a lot of quality details when upscaling from 480p to 4k.(or even 1080p for that matter in this TV). Netflix has only a few shows in 4K and YouTube has a lot of 4k videos.. Since FHD is still the standard for most things in India..it's preferrable to go for this tv unless you wanna game using PS4 plus or upcoming PS5.. Now coming to the Tv.. it has a great quality 1080p display.. Being smart Android tv.. you can download apps directly from Google Play Store on to your TV..It has around 8gigs internal storage and if you own google nest or mini version you can use it to control your TV too.. Go for it without any thought.. You won't be dissapointed . the only drawback of ghis tv is since it does not have mic you cannot use Google assistant directly to control it but as I said earlier you can use Google nest or mini to control it with voice.. This TV also has an internal Chromecast built in.. (That's why it's smart TV).. You need not buy one.. it's official Google Android smart TV..

Best tv ever! It's been two weeks since I purchased it. Prime, YouTube, Netflix are pre installed and works great. Initially I couldn't install any app from TV's play store. Thanks to VU Support they advised me to clear the cache memory of Google play, now it's working fine. Watching entire match online through hotstar without any hassle. The picture quality is superb. TV has Bluetooth as well so one can connect Bluetooth headphones as well for sound.

TV looks gud after 2 months of using stripes are appeared on TV display, after raising complaint they replaced TV and the replaced TV looks like refurbished, not a new one and picture, voice are not gud.Again I raised complaint but no one responded. No extended warranty available by default, one have to buy extended warranty separately...

When I purchased it, I was facing trouble in casting tv with my phone, and zee5 was not working properly, But both problems resolved with first software update. + video quality is good, the sound is loud and clear. UI is good.The problems I can see now is: Half star lost here.1. The missing feature is: no mic/ voice button on remote + voice feature does not work, you can only type key by key using remote which is very hectic thing, when you could just speak and get things types on screen.Below mentioned 2 points are negligible and can be ignored or might be fixed in upcoming releases.2. amazon prime not working, but this is working in the Casting feature.3. sound is a little distorted when we surf/move between apps, only that sound is distorted, tv sound is awesome.Build quality- half star lost here.4. The screen is not 100% fit and taped on corner boundary, I can see light coming out at some places standing parellet to screen, this point I am not considering since we have paid half the price of LG/ Samsung haha.I got this 40-inch device in 18500, 1000 amazon pay cashback I got and 1850 I will get in SBI bank account cashback, So I got it for 15650 :)  + plus point is, got both stands with TV, MItv does not wall mount stand, so save of 400 Rs again. + got Acko 1 year extra warranty from Amazon because of Big festival Sale.Earlier I was confused because of a few above points, but casting resolved half of my doubts :)You can buy it without much doubt.

Bought this TV 6 days ago.. overall the TV is good but I think there's a problem with Right side speaker of my TV. It makes a buzzing (vibration) sound when audio/video is played, and always while navigating the TV from left to right..while moving left the left speaker sounds perfect but while moving Right the right speaker makes a buzzing sound (I've tried increasing the speaker and muting). Thinking of replacement. Otherwise the overall quality is good.

Pro1.Sound volume is good but quality is not.2.Ease of Connectivity is good.3. Picture Brightness and Contrast are good when viewed right from front (90deg)4. Composite ports and USB ports responding well but USB 1 is not recognised.Cons1. Disappointing point is the picture quality when vied from an angle.Against claims of 178deg viewing angle, the quality goes on deteriorating as the angle increases and at 178deg it is bad.2.The operating Manual is too concise. Just passing mention about Chromecast, Bluetooth etc and if one is not already some sort of an expert, it will be difficult.Overall Fair quality. Value for money.

Picture quality is goodCons1. there is a lot of lag although very small ones;2. the TV does not pick up 5G network;3. the sound quality is average (I have connected my Bluetooth speaker for better quality).

It's wonderful TV. Writing review after using it three months. All the smart features works well.  Excellent picture quality. Connectivity is very much good.  It got delivered on time and with excellent package.Worst thing is customer service.  I installed the TV by paying amount. Company said installation is free of cost, but nobody came to do so. After calling several times and wasting my time, they came for installation after three weeks that too on condition of paying them for installation, that's worst thing from VU.

The whole experience with the TV is really good. Amazing picture clarity and sound output is commendable. All the apps works perfectly except Prime Video which is a bummer. Amazon says that the TV is not supported. Not sure why they advertise that it support Prime Video.VFM product if you don't mind the issue with Prime Video.*****Edit*****Changing my rating to 5 Stars. Prashanth from VU called me up and said that the issue should be fixed by updating the software to the latest version. I updated to the latest one (Sept 16th release). It still didn't work. Prashanth asked me to factory reset once.After doing a factory reset, Prime Video started working.Happy with the service and happy with the product. :)

It is not a matured android tv.Problems:-1) Unable to do initial configurations with mobile,it simply does not connect to it so need to enter app login credentials through on screen key board which is cumbersome to do with tv remote.2) Every time there is a new firmware update it simply gets reset so now you need to start initial configs again. Do hotstar,amazone prime,google, Zee4 .... and several other app registration again and yeah you need to download them again.3) remote does not have voice recognition.4) Bottom clamp stands are wide and slightly bent outwards so u need a sufficiently bigger table if using table mount.4) When using screen cast it lags in display, so when you swipe to next picture on your phone it will display the next pic on tv screen after about 5 seconds. Forget about HD videos.Okok:-Screen and colour quality is acceptable at this cost.Sound is also normal.

Brought  Vu premium and Vu UltraAndroid for myself and relatives so here's my short summary.Before getting into the positive  I just want to point out the one con i found so far which is the lack fo 3.o Usb ports for the TV it comes with 2 USB 2.0 ports only.Now, Let's get into the picture quality ,the picture quality is really good with good brightness level and contrast.  FHD channels looks pretty good too.  i don't think you can beat this TV's picture quallity  compared to other TVs on a budget, First thing you notice is how well it upscales Videos that are non FHD to look miles  better. Espcially when there are still alot of Tv channels  in SD,this upscaling feature alone makes the tv worthy along with picture quality.In terms of Android experience it's pretty much Stock android Pie tv experience with occasional  lags here and there even high end Android TV's have this issue so not much to complain here. Tv comes with Netflix Amazon prime youtube and  hotstar installed with first 3apps getting their own  dedicated buttons on the remote .  The picture quality through streaming is pretty good too.Coming to the sound quality i found it  better then my mi soundbar and prefered to use inbuilt tv speaker.It's got good bass ,clarity and quite loud .Conclusion If you are looking mainly for the picture quality on a budget you should be better going of with this or the  non Android VU Ultra Tv for 16k. IF you don't mind spending an extra few thousands you should consider getting the VU premium android 4k not that there are lot of 4k content, but even the FHD channels looks so much better in that tv its more vivid and black levels are deep.  Streamed 4k videos though Youtube to my Vu premium the picture quality is great and got great details to it.For full detailed review i found Techiebeez india channel to have good review of this TV.
Good Value for one's money, Good picture n sound quality, Till now no problem..

As a TV, it is a good buy. The picture and sound is good. TV design is good but its the software that is a let down. the resolution of home screen etc is a let down. Its not sharp at all. Netflix is working but we are unable to use AMAZON prime ( it is a built in app ). Its much better to buy VU Non Smart tv and purchase a Fire Stick or equi.While that was by earlier review. VU sorted out the problem almost immediately and they definitely deserve a mention and a pat on the back. Seems like my SMART TV is SMART once again. I would not only recommend the tv for the display and sound, but also VU as a brand that is Prompt in AFTER SALES.

I bought this TV last year in Oct 2019 under exchange offer. Working well, picture and sound quality is perfect as per price. Customer care is also quick responsive. I contacted customer care through email and received response within 48 hours (before COVID-19 pandemic). I love their remote that have shortcut buttons for HotStar, Amazon Videos, YouTube, Netflix, it save lot of time and patience while changing the videos.The only issue I am facing is, I can not disable Bluetooth. Customer care recommended to install some app, that I have installed and activated but even after that, I keep getting BLUETOOTH PAIR request from my neighboring devices. Finally we decide to accept the pair if we get any request (not sure what is advantage or disadvantage of doing this).Overall working well and we are fully satisfied.

After use of this tv, the sound quality is totaly worst,Suddenly sounds goes to louder and after dialogue the sounds goes down , the dialogue are not clear ,After that i try to replace it, the Amazon care will booked it with wron address, after that I try to replace the address, i am unable to reach at Amazon,I thin service are not good by Amazon,I am not recommend TV, this TV is not Dolby sound, i this they are just print as dolly TV.

I had considered a lot lot of options before I settled down for VU TV. Initially I had a lot of ambiguities as to how VU TV would perform because I had no idea about the TV and its after-sales services. However, today after using the TV for 2 months I am pretty happy and satisfied with my purchase.Pros:a) It has the best display panel and the picture quality is just awesome. Even many of the high end TVs would fall short when compared to this TV with regards to the picture quality.b) many people here have complained that prime video does not work. However be assured that all the smart features off the TV work perfectly fine. Although I would personally recommend to use the TV to view satellite channels and at best USB videos for the best utility.c) Amazon had sent it with utmost care. So kudos to Amazon for perfect packaging and careful delivery.d) VU gives one year warranty on the TV. But an additional 2 years (total 3) can be availed at a very nominal price. It cost me around 1400. So my VU TV is now secured for 3 years, which is a long time.e) Last but the most important is it's price. Such a beautiful TV at 10,999/- and an additional 1,000/- Amazon pay balance is indeed an awesome deal!Cons:a) The only issue I felt is with the sound output. The background score is louder than the dialogues. But if you change the settings it becomes perfectly fine.So this is my honest review regarding the TV. Please go ahead and buy your TV.

Almost all the points were covered in other reviews from various customers. I don't want to repeat them again.Based on my usage from one week I felt picture clarity is very good, sound is also good. no need to separate speakers unless you want high woofer effects.I had faced issue with promevideo like many other users. I was able to resolve it by resetting the settings. Thanks for the solution by some users in the reviews section.Another issue which I am facing is with Jio cinema. I have installed the Jio Cinema app from the playstore. But I am not able to open the app. I am getting the error, unable to process the request, please try again later.Also I am not able to do casting also from jio cinema app from my mobile.I thought this issue also will be resolved after the system reset. But it didn't.If anybody is facing the similar issue and found any solution, please update.Apart from that all other apps are working fine.It is very good deal from amazon during the great Indian festival.I will add more points after exploring the product in detail.

This smart TV is bang for your buck for the price that you pay. However, when you say android; you expect it to also have accessibility features. This TV does not support the android accessibility suite or Google Talk Back which is a must have for persons with a print disability.This is my 3rd TV from VU. I started with my first; which was a LCD model and that time I was able to see and was impressed by the finish and the features it offered me as a PlayStation gamer. I got my second TV from VU and it was a LED; I probably used it for 2 to 3 years when I was tempted to go in for a smart or android TV. This got me to this page on amazon and since they had an exchange and offer that I could not refuse, why not I said. Although the exchange price I got for my old TV wasn't impressive.I am very impressed by the way the exchange and installation was carried out; having the challenges of the pandemic; the support staff was very courteous and dispite my disability they were helpful and polite throughout the process.This smart TV has a lot to offer in terms of performance and variety of settings for sound and picture. It also has great ways to connect to accessories via BlueTooth; the remote I am given to understand is a BlueTooth device that runs on 2 AAA batteries. I am impressed that despite not having the accessibility feature in the android system, the remote follows standard design with tactile buttons for the few keys we need immediate access to. Don't understand why they have wasted so much space on the remote for the number pad, they have a separate key for the Play and Pause button; they could have clubbed it into one. The remote has quick access keys to pre-installed apps. like Amazon Prime, HotStar, NetFlix etc. Sorry, forgot to mention; you cannot use the Google Assistant with the remote they give you with the TV; you will have to buy a new one if you want to use the Google Assistant which costs you another 2,500. Overall as I said earlier bang for your buck, but if you are looking for the one accessibility feature that I was, you will be highly disappointed. Sound quality on all the modes not making much of a difference unless set to news, you cannot hear dialogue on any of the movies clearly but you will get the bells and whistles clearly and loud!Conclusion: With the above limitations I would still say, Go for it, it's bang for your buck!

**This is a genuine review posted by a genuine Customer**Placing Order:I have placed the order during the great Indian festival and got a discount on the original price. I have purchased this TV for 21000. I have also opted out for Acko Insurance.Delivery:I live in a city which is connected by railways and transport very well with the major cities like Hyderabad and Banglore. As the seller cloudtail shipped my product from Greater thane I was pretty sure that I will get delivery within 3 days. But that did not happen. Due to the ongoing sale and Diwali holidays, I have received the product after 8 days.Amazon delivered the product within the deadline.First Impression:After the delivery, I have unboxed the TV and put it on the stand given in the box. The setup of the tv is not that difficult as it is an Android TV. After the whole setup, I quickly jumped to the video qualityVideo:Video quality is better than LG and close to Samsung. Brightness is slightly high but it won't bother you if you are not going to stick to the premium led panels expectations.Audio:Audio quality has impressed me. It is better than the premium rivals. The 20W output is good enough for 10 feet distance.Speed:As it is an android tv, it comes with inbuilt RAM and storage. The 1 GB ram will keep you wait for 30 seconds when you press on from your remote. After 30 seconds the home screen appears. Once you get started there is no such delay in operations.Interface: Interface is stock android and customizable.Connectivity:Wifi, Bluetooth and USB ports works very wellRemote:You can handle the majority of tasks using remote and remote has soft textured keys.Installation:For the installation, I had to call VU customer care to place an installation request. The installation guy came after 1day. He was skilled enough to mount the TV properly. I have found VU customer care good enough till now.Overall Comment:I personally think that as my budget was within 25000 rupees and I wanted a tv with youtube and Full HD capabilities, this one is a good choice and my family doesn't watch the TV whole day. It's a good tv and I suggest this tv if you have a budget within 25000 but don't expect too much like sony or any premium brand as you are buying a product considering the price point. I found this TV fulfilling all my needs. I have chosen this TV over price and I am very satisfied with my choice. I didn't want to purchase a TV worth 44K just to watch for 1 hour.Overall I will rate this TV 4 stars. If brightness is adjusted and some more RAM is given then I would have might give it 5 stars.
I'm not able able to view prime video full movie by clicking  "Watch Now" I can only watch the trailer from the prime video. I have called amazon prime video CC for help they told they will check.

i ordered the tv  on 29th sep 2019 and received on 5th oct and installed on 6th oct.the installation guy installed the tv and shown me some operations. after that i started using the tv  .  i purchased this tv  because this tv directly support prime video and hotstar and hot keys given on remote it self. i tried to open hotstar but failed . after lot of brain storming i decided to download the app and i did the same  it gave me a code to verify i followed the procedure and enjoying it. no problems  the same thing happened with zee 5 alssonow the real story starts now  i am not able to open prime video. it is asking me sign in , i did the same and it gave me  a code and with that code i registered my tv. then it allowed me browse the content. when i am opening some movie it is not at all opening  and saying about some error and suggesting contact prime video help. but i could not get any help from that. finally  i thought if i update the software i may find some solution. it 1 hour for me how to update  it.finally i updated it and i am able to watch from prime video. but  very very frustating  point is if you switch off the tv and again you have to re login and verify your tv . this is very very frustating to me so far i made near about 15 login  it is not happening with any other app, why it is happening with prime video . i hope vu and amazon prime video will resolve this problem at the earliest. here i am attaching 5 photos regarding how to update. finally i am giving only four stars  and cutting one star with respect to prime video app. let me check the remaining apps after that i will come back

The effort of service personnel Mr.Senthil and Bismi electronics appreciated.Old review.1.Will only download apps with a very fast network, like more than 15 MBps2 Intermittent loss of sound, needs to be reset again3.Apps don't updateOtherwise good for Netflix and prime.

UPDATE: Apr 21, 2020Vu's service team fixed the TV soon after my review. Apparently it needed a software upgrade which somehow couldn't happen online but the service guy had to do it using his flashdrive. Most of the issues are now fixed. I still do not like the sound system, but otherwise the TV is serving its purpose for now. Wonder why new purchases couldn't have had the latest software updates installed already. I'd still deduct 2 stars for the sound quality.ORIGINAL POST: Mar 11, 2020I don’t regret any other Amazon purchase as I do for this Vu TV. I am someone who buys low-cost brand’s TVs because I like upgrading every few years. I had a 40” Micromax non-smart/standard TV for the last 3 years and it worked like a charm. I liked the picture quality and the sound and it worked decently with my Firestick. Then I decided to upgrade to a smart tv and not rely just on my Firestick for streaming apps. Oh boy, why did I choose Vu! Issues with this smart TV: the screen goes blank/black randomly, doesn’t matter if you are streaming over the web or casting a video from your laptop. There was a short powercut and it messed up the volume of the TV when it turned on. I could volume up to 100% and could hear as if it’s only 20% volume. The other day the home screen loaded in just half of the screen. You can’t hear the sound well in the room but every other faraway room gets the sound from the TV pretty loudly, no it’s not a messed up sound setting, we tried them all. Responsiveness to remote operations is slow too.Unfortunately, I was travelling and the return window expired by the time I discovered all these issues. I seriously regret buying  this. For economical brands, please look elsewhere. Now I fear how the post-sale service will be for this brand.

This is my first android tv and hope that I get a good experience using it for at least 6-7 years. My initial review is, picture and sound quality is good, wi-fi connectivity is also good, it is easier to setup, HD content is awesome, SD content with my IN cable setup box is ok. Overall a happy customer as I got it a good price.

1. Amazon Prime works fine on some occasions, but  not able to store credentials, so again and again login is required.2. On some occasions, composite video souce is not detected, so we have to give restart to tv, then it works.3. Default source selection option is not available, so u need tv remote every time u need to watch your dish tv.Within two days vu support team visited the home and resolved almost all issues. Default input selection is not possible in this model, so keep TV remote along with cable TV remote.I am satisfied with the support and resolution.

Vu ultra 32 inch smart tv review :Bought it for 11.8K and it is worth every penny. The smart features are excellent. Audio options are good. Some of you may feel, the voice is not enhanced but the music is. You need to adjust options in sound settings. Picture quality is good but the default picture option is too bright. Let's see pros and consPros : Picture quality, Sound options, Smart features, Quick app change options, Google home, Chromecast is quick, multimedia plays most of the formatsCons : Takes time after turning on (from total switch off), volume displays with a time lag when you increase or reduce, voice search is not working at all.Overall, a safe bet to buy and this is the best tv under 12k without even an inch of a doubt. The neutral installation service person also said this the best tv in 32 inches under 12k right now. Go for it.

When I was booking this TV there was no ratings but now I could see plenty of negative comments, To be honest I do not know giving a positive rating at this juncture is correct or not as it is too early to judge/comment, but in my personal opinion on my last 2 days experience the product is very good for its price tag and the working features with the device.Secondly I've gone through all negative reviews and compared it with my TV, unfortunately none of them are valid, Prime is perfectly registered and we finished watching 2 full movie as well.  But yes couple of vital things are missing "Mic enabled remote" and "Bluetooth" with some hiccups here and there but eventually the product is phenomenal in my 2 days experience.

Bought this 32" Android TV during Dussehra Sale for a meagre amount which was little less than even 10K. Very Good Deal, picture and sound quality is good. Connectivity is seamless (WiFi, Bluetooth, Casting), package included a wall mount.Took a while to resolve the Amazon Prime app issue. The issue is that after login to Amazon Prime app, it will ask additional registration on primevideo/mytv site. Even after registering, the app doesn't proceed further. This issue was resolved after following the 2 steps:1. System Update (Settings, About the Phone, System Update)2. If the above doesn't solve, do a factory reset. (Settings, About the Phone, Reset)

Smart Features works well - 4 StarPicture quality - 5 StarVoice Recognisation - 3 Star (Does not work sometimes and gives an error).Sound Quality - 3 Star (Sound quality is not so good even after it's of 24 watts).For Installation Service - NO STAR - WORST SERVICES PROVIDED BY AMAZON. Ordered this tv on Friday evening. Got it for around 17300 rs after applying all eligible discounts.It got delivered on Saturday morning. The installation was requested for Sunday morning but as the installation person was in same area on Saturday evening, installation was complete on Saturday itself.From Amazon part, delivery and installation was before time 🙂Now coming to the product,Considering price, it is truly amazing. The bazels are reasonably thin, TV is quite slim as well.Panel is very bright (due to the fact that vu uses Direct led panels instead of edge led), color reproduction is more on a saturated side but overall good. Viewing angles are also fine. So overall picture quality is good. Not a big fan of cricket so can't comment on cricket mode.Sound quality is good but not that great. When surround sound is on, music tends to become loud which makes the vocals muffled. I use home theatre so this doesn't bother me.As this is pure android tv, it has got a stock android interface which i like over custom interfaces like patchwall is web os. Navigation is almost smooth. Remote is not the bluetooth one but still works well. Voice recognition is not supported by remote but can be done using android tv remote app on Google Play. It has dedicated buttons for Netflix, YouTube, prime video, bistar and Google Play which works well.Doesn't lag even after having only 1 gb of ram, probably that it due to stock android. It is running Android 9 out of the box which is good.Prime video works fine after a reset!Overall this is a good budget smart tv if you don't want fancy things like HDR10, voice remote and all which in practicality never used.

I am writing this post one months of use.Pros - Good picture quality, though not 4k it will play  4k videos in good quality.Good sound effect. Even I tried many times to use YouTube voice option but it's not working.

I bought this tv this September for 9.2k. After 10days of use I'm reviewing this product.Pros :1. Dedicated buttons for Amazon Prime, Netflix, YouTube,Hotstar.2. Picture Quality is good.3. Sound quality is awesome.4. U will get wall mount with tv.5. Connects with WiFi easily.6. Build quality is good.7. Android 9 pie version.Cons :1. No Google assistance.2. Every time u have to login to Amazon prime when u turn on Ur tv. Which is irritating. No remember me option.For this range I don't think u will get better TV. So my advice go for it.

Its been 3 months after purchasing this tv. At first i think of buying top brand. But noticed only after getting feedback from amazon and friends. Thank you for them to help me choose a good product. And about the tv, color quality is very good than my expectations with a good display quality in crazy budget. All smart features is there and working fine. You will definitely be surprised with the quality guys. For this price there is no such comparison. definitely go for it. Thank you amazon for quick delivery and set up.

I got it delivered in time... so the delivery aspect is very good. If you are buying this product for "NETFLIX" or "AMAZON PRIME" please please please think twice.... or thrice... For me It worked for two days.. then whenever i try to connect i get a message with some error code (even the codes are not same every time... some random error codes) which seems to blame the network. All my devices are working fine, at least no network issues. All other apps including YouTube is working just fine. Since the remote has dedicated buttons for the above said two apps, expecting them to work perfectly is fair and those apps not working is unfair.

Absolutely brilliant! I was little skeptical about buying it since it was offering so much for so little. Its a 32 inch smart tv which offers great colours and contrast and surprisingly the white balance offered is good at this price. Sound quality is fine though not great. Smart TV features are working smoothly (youtube, Amazon prime, sonyliv ) i had no issues while launching applications or while streaming them infact i can compare it with my firestick which i have for my other room. It also has a  blutooth receiver as well The build quality is more than acceptable. It doesn't feel clumsy at all, the provided Remote is also sturdy and its buttons are responsive.  The only thing which is at the downside is the OSD menu which could have been better in terms of screen positioning and the user interface ... Anybody who wants to buy a smart tv should not think twice ..just go for it ! Its a steal at the current discounts and offers ..

The TV is good as far as the picture quality is concerned.Don't expect a "wow" crisp display, you cannot compare this to a Samsung / Sony / Panasonic.It's decent for the price you are paying.Sound is good.The only feature with lacks detailing is the smart feature. You can't install thrid party apps. The store is very limited as far as app. selection goes. I would suggest two things1. Go for Mi or buy a Amazon firesitck or the chrome cast.

Amazon prime plays only HD Video in 720p but Tv has 1080p display. The sound is Not properly come out through tv for 2-3 starting minutes on Amazon prime. The blutooth range is not good. I am standing infront of Tv about 1-2 meter away and my wireless headphones is not working properly . The sound in headphones are coming into pieces means not coming properly.Tv pictures quality is okay and sound is okay too. Sometimes if you play Full HD video , there is no sound coming out from it.When I first started TV , It was hanged and laggy then I did factory reset two to three times then the tv navigation works properly. I want to turn off the sound of navigation but I didn't find any option into this tv . Overall Tv is nice if you ignore these problems. Please fix sound problem in TV's Next OTA update.

Best deal for the price. I have bought this one since I can get prime videos on iffalcon TCL TV or else I would have purchased their own already got 40 inches iffalcon tv.BUT, this one has Prime Videos so it's a bonus for our family.Pros:* Picture quality.* Performance is fast (exception: prime videos is a slow app in itself)* Looks great with thinner bezels* Many advanced settings for changing picture quality* Voice search (not every smart tv offers this feature)Cons:* Sound quality - bizzare (if you're used to of listening to external speakers with good quality - you can take about half hour to 1 hour to accept the average sound quality subconsciously)* No shortcut button for opening picture quality settings on the fly while any app is opened. Must go to home the fiddle with many menus to get there.* Voice search is supported by Android TV Control app but for some reason, it opens text search even though I press mic button for a voice search. I must go to HOME and then manually choose voice search then use my phone for voice search.Verdict:Go for it! You'll not regret it once you've found the picture quality settings as per your liking (no further changes needed, no menu navigation hassle). And if you have external speakers - sound quality issue is gone as well. Even if you don't have external speakers for some reason - yours ears get used to the sound within 15 minutes. Just focus on the content rather than the audio. :D Voice search isn't much big of a requirement as it's usability is limited.Suggestion: With such a cheap TV, a good sound bar or speaker system will turn this into a great bedroom home theater system. ;)

Great panel with true black levels..great value for money you can get a level of picture clarity like in samsung,sony etc...Pros: 1 colour production is excellent  2 True black levels  60hz is good 4k is playing smoothly(only  max out in 1080)  3 good finish and design&weightless  4 low power consumption  5 looks like a premium tv like samsung,sony  6 great pricingCons: 1 overall bootup time is long  2 processor is not that much fast( but ok)  3 sound is good surround but less base.voice  clarity is low. It is good to get a sound bar.Overall: less cons more pros.  1  In terms of panel it is the best.you won't  regret it and really feels like samsung or  sony panels.  2  sound is good dolby digital plus  3  great pricing and great package of  display, sound, design.Defenitly you can go for it....

It's been 10 days and so far my experience with VU Ultra Android range has been phenomenal. The picture quality is really vibrant and vivid. The colours are perfect in this range. The display is far better than it's competitors and also the colours seem pretty natural.Coming to the sound section, the 20W surround sound Dolby system is absolutely mind blowing. The voice is clear and the music just mellows your ears. The bass and everything is pretty good and at this price point everything works phenomenal.Netflix works perfectly. Every other Android supported application runs the same. The Chromecast feature also works flawlessly.The only issue I have faced is with Amazon Prime video. The TV supports the app. But the app has not been registered with Vu TVs till now. So registering of the device doesn't work. So using amazon video works currently with Chromecast feature only.Apart from this everything is perfect.
Nice product value of money

Review after first OTA update on October 9th 2019. I have been using the 32 inch android tv for a week now. The picture quality is amazing.Its an android tv so one has access to all important apps. Netflix, Prime video, hotstar, youtube among others. Users have been facing issue with accessing primevideo, but the latest Ota update solves the problem. Just update and do a factory reset.Viola it works!The sound is decent as well. You can pair bluetooth headset as well. The inbuilt speakers are also decent for a small room.Over all a quality tv for the price. Go for it.

Been using this tv since 3 months. No problems till now, works great, sometimes lags but that's not the big problem considering the price you paying. Picture quality is great too. SD channels look descent but I suggest opt for HD channels. Viewing angles are also good colours do wash out a little if viewed from corner. Otherwise it's definitely a bang for buck. If you're planning to buy a 40 inch budget TV don't look anywhere and straight away go for this (this tv is better than mi 40 inch tv). VU itself will send you extended warranty of 3 years details through email (For my case it cost me 1770  Rs for the extended warranty). If you want to buy 43 inch variant of this tv i suggest you stretch out a little and go for the pixelight series of VU available on Flipkart.Cheers

Purchased VU 43" Smart TV from Amazon and I pretty impressed with everything so far right from price, delivery, service and features.1) Price- I bought this TV at a price of ₹20,000 from Amazon. I would say that this the best price for such aTV with so many features.2) Delivery- On time delivery without any chaser calls or anything. I was getting status of delivery on real time basis.3) Service/Installation- Installation guy himself called me without me calling Amazon customer care. He came on time, installed it well amd explained all features to me in detail.4) Product- Sound and Picture quality very good. You can connect bluetooth speakers as well. Response time is less than 5 secs which is fine.Overall verdict- I rate 5 stars for the product. Rated 1 star as this tv does not support voice recognition. But that's ok you can still search for your favourite songs and videos.

I bought this after comparing it with many other branded TVs such as Samsung, Xiaomi, LG, Motorola, etc. But finally decided to buy this because it's an Indian brand and the features and quality it offers are comparable to those Big brands as Samsung and LG and can easily beat Chinese made TVs in terms of display and sound quality & clarity. I recommend this TV to all those who are in a tight budget but want a really good picture quality and sound in a TV that too from an Indian Brand. Also, the latest Android 9.0, Bluetooth 5.0, and Chromecast works very well. The interface is easy to operate. Also, you get five shortcut keys for each streaming media (Hotstar, Netflix, Amazon Prime, and Youtube) in remote itself, so no hassle. I faced no connectivity issues so far. As far as voice control is concerned, one can use their smartphones to operate their tv via Google Assistance, you just need to download the Google assistance app and apply settings to it.

After a weeks usage, i find this as an excellent choice for its picture quality and sound. For me sound is adequate as i use it in my bedroom. As it is a VA panel, i have installed it in a straight position, but i do watch from an angle without any issues. I can assure u need not require any Samsung or Sony for picture quality. VU is well above my expectation. I had a 40inch 3D Full HD Samsung 7 series smart tv in 2012 which i imported for nearly 75k. Even that tv lasted for 7yrs and almost never used 3D goggles and content, gesture commands and smart tv features. So in my opinion dont overspend for electronics which keeps on updating. nd go for a mediocre one. A value for money piece. You can very well go for this tv if you want to gift your dad or mom a tv for bed time watch. At 11k its really value for money. Amazon prime works flawlessly after the update. Disney+ Hotstar app is installable as it is an android tv. Only downside i find was about voice recognition as remote does not support it.

The initial order had a picture tube defect, so i got it replaced with a brand new TV. The overall build quality and experience is pretty decent in this price range. Just a few things to note for new users:1. For regular viewing, use "Sports" preset for Sound and "Movie" mode for watching anything from Netflix to DTH.2. For playing games on PS4 like I do, use "Standard" mode under video settings.3. If you feel the contrast is too high and the exposure is too low especially for dark colours like black, play around with the colour configuration a bit and you'll figure it out.If you're able to figure out colour and picture settings for different inputs and outputs, you'll enjoy this product. Else it can be a nightmare especially if you're moving from Samsung or Panasonic to this TV for regular viewing.Also, bluetooth is laggy at times, but it's not that bad. Only issue is every time you've got to pair again and again for some reason, which can be frustrating, especially if you use the same bluetooth headphones with other devices as well. The bluetooth audio levels are also pretty low no matter how good your headphones are.But all of this is just a little bit of sacrifice I'd say, when you look at the specs of the product and compare those with the price at which they're being offered by other competitors.My whole idea of buying this product was to hook up my PS4, and it is serving the purpose well. I can even tell a big difference between running stock YouTube and Netflix via PS4 on this TV, versus when I run the in-built YouTube and Netflix in this smart TV. Sony is again a different class altogether, but VU isn't that bad either for this price. All in all, a very good deal and decent product from an Indian company! :)

The product is of very good quality,picture and sound quality is excellent according to price,screen cast/mirror is very slow responding,youtube video plays effortlessly, the installation guy didn't have good knowledge about product,he only knows how to wall mount the TV. Delivery time is very long. Also have MI 43 inch 4a tv and VU had better picture and sound quality. Rest update after more use.

I got the 40 inch Vu Smart android TV and it is just awesome at this price. I bought it in amazon sale. Initially all the apps(Netflix, Youtube, Hotstar, Zee5) were working fine expect prime video which was disappointing but the installation guy installed some update of 840 MB, reset the TV settings and then all apps were working smoothly. The clarity is amazing and is visible clearly from any angle. Though I was not impressed with the sound but that can be ignored as most of the TV's do not have awesome sound. I have compensated that with JBL soundbar and now its superb experience for me.For this price range this Vu TV fulfills all the criteria and if you want are planning to buy go for this.

Excellent TV. Delivered on time. After a long research from internet decided to buy Vu Ultra Android TV 40 inches which also fits in budget.I have waited a long to get 10% Discount through my Card. Finally Product delivered in January 2020.Pros:1. Definately the Picture Quality with Vivid colour.2. Brightness of the screen. Need to lower the brightness to keep my eyes stress free.3. Sound quality is good. I don't need to turn on Fenda 2.1 sound system. Some users complaint about a humming sound for high bass, but don't get panic, it's common with all LED TV, even I have seen the same on Samsung.4. Can play almost all types of video files through pen drive. Now, I have stopped my movie outing !Cons:1. After installation, noticed a cloth type meterial comes out from TV screen in left hand side. Ask Amazon for replacement, they replaced. But surprisingly, the replacement TV also have the same issue. (See picture, marked in red box)2. Lagging during casting my mobile. (I don't use it much)3. Booting Time high.4. Sometime sound becomes lowered by itself, slove after a reboot.5. As it comes with VA panel, viewing angle is not good.In short, it's a good purchase as compared to its price with other branded TV like Samsung and LG.

Picture quality is very good for given price.All Apps work very well. Sound is also good even speakers are at lower position.Only Drawback is voice recognition will not work amd casting too.You need to install Mobile app separately for it.Conclusion: You can buy it if you are getting it below 12k amount ,So that it will be a value for your Money .

I have been using this for 2 months now..Installation in Mumbai is very smooth.. Amazon allows you to choose set up slot.. Technician called me and came over on schedule.. Set it up in half an hour and left.. Very courteous and no riff raff.Very easy to install apps as well.. I have Netflix, Prime, Hotstar, Zee, JioTv, Spotify and few more.. All work seamlessly once it has been setup.Video quality is very sharp and colors are quite vivid.Can couch for Audio being perfect for bedroom watching.Issues - There is some lag, when switching from one app to another.. It's not as seamless as say watching TV with a set top box.. Surprising since it using Android Pie.Also I can see the bidding/glue in the top corner that was used to paste the frame onto the glass. So slightly shoddy workmanship.Overall I have no regrets.. This is as good as can get within 20k.

Best TV for viewing Full HD content at very competitive price. Go for it.You need to tweak settings a little bit to make it  more appealing. Picture quality is good. Go with only HD content from DTH or Cable TV. I bet you'll definitely love this TV with HD channels.
We had to change the TV once poor voice quality.. after exchange works fine.. overall voice quality can improve otherwise value for money. Good customer service by VU..

Overall happy with the product. It is very less in price compare to other products with same features in market. Overall a good deal. Only thing that I feel missing is voice recognization in remote. Amazon app is still ot working even with the patch. But it still serves the purpose, I am very happy with purchase in this low budget.

Guys order this with little apprehensions but I am really happy with this product, relief is also that my wife doesnt like non branded products , she too is impressed this TVHaving little challenge in mirroring but  still to try properly, keeping little bz :)

The installer came and gave a quick demo but was not equipped to activate the voice recognition feature. Hence I have given a blank rating on that.The screen cast / mirroring experience is pathetic. I have absolutely no delay when I use a Chromecast device cast fitted on a normal (non-Smart) Sanyo TV over the same wi-fi network.The users manual is also below expectation. Nice TV with Android 9 out of the box.Netflix,Hot star & YouTube are working fine, however struggling with Amazon prime... Able To cast however the inbuilt app doesn't work. Highly Disappointed with installation service after 16 days they called for same. A smart tv without mic enabled remote. I mean how would i be able to use google assistant. As soon as i click on mic icon it gets disabled. Unable to login to prime video. Amazon confirmed that it does not support vu tv. Disappointed

When VU launched in India with LCD screen, i was impressed by there picture quality during that time. My First LCD was from VU which didn't gave issue for good 7 Years. After that it started giving LCD panel issue and went blank. Since Technologies changed LED gave better quality i thought to go for the VU LED TV. These was the second from VU, which i bought 2 years back. Today as i Write this second VU product gave the same issue, LED Panel display has gone blank. When the VU technician visit to check the issue, the option given is to replace the Display Panel. Which cost equivalent to new one. Also they have scripted answer, with Humidity /moisture this are common issues. I read some of the blogs this is one of the common issue reported by other user. Bought this in sale with a good discount of 10% off at https://amzn.to/2q1hWkK.New TV in 2019 from VU brand. It is Android smart tv with 1 year product warranty. Comes with pre-installed PRIME VIDEO. This is a good deal as other brand TVs are overpriced in this category. Really a value for money product, gives good video and sound quality at this price. Inbuilt Chromecast, Bluetooth and all other features are working well.Can say it’s a best smart Android LED TV with tight budgets. Performance of TV is as per the expectation. Sound quality is great, no need to buy external sound system unless you are sound freak. Amazon delivery & installation is good. Patch wall is simple and easy to use. Videos are sharp and well balanced.If you could stretch your budget a bit, my advice is to go with TCL 4K UHD from here https://amzn.to/2P4JPm8 for getting even more & greater quality.Anyways, few PROS and CONS from my side to be shared:PROS1. Build and look is classy & premium remote.2. Viewing distance of 10-15 feet.3. Comes with the strong wall mount brackets.4. Super clarity and colour reproduction works pretty well.5. Pre-installed apps are working fine.6. Play store provides tons of other options.7. Good quality from sound system.CONS1. Sometimes Android and apps get crashed.2. Phone mirroring works but lags by a few seconds.3. Voice search is missing.4. Needs factory reset for Amazon prime to work.

Nice quality of pictures. Sound quality is ok. Supports Bluetooth, joystick and external speakers. So u can buy it without any hesitation.

Guys. This is a HD Ready TV. Which means it supports HD with the help of a HD Media Box. I suggest you guys buy a Full HD TV instead but it costs more. And other things is that a Smart TV can make problems in the future. The OS can crash or the pre installed apps can make problems too. It's always better to buy a Normal Full Hd Tv and an alternate Android Media Box. This will help you from cost cutting for sure. The other problem is ,smart tv's are like a Mini Computer with Processor and ram. So don't forget to use a UPS for the LED TV's. Or else the life of the Backlight LED's will be lesser and will cost you a lot.

Better read full review if u r buying this tv. Pros and Cons r below. So lets begin.This is My 2nd VU tv and I am enjoying it. This tv is best if u watch a lot of ott content (Netflix,Amazon,youtube etc) and tv channels. Hd setupbox is preferred to get good clearity. Sd channels are also good but it depends on transmission quality of that channel. Hassle free and fluid operation of tv as expected. This is a Tv and not a mobile phone or pc so playing games from playstore is not advisable, however if u have a PlayStation then this tv won't disappoint u.Pros:Good Picture QualityGood soundInstalls and Plays almost every app u throw at it (not talking about high graphic games like pubg, asphalt etc)wireless headphones, mouse, keyboard, gaming joystick support.Lots of settings to tweak your tv as per uer video and audio preferences.5star bee rating for electricity consumption.Dedicated keys on remote for apps preinstalled on tv.Everything works super fine once u update and reset uer tv.Cheaper than 4k tv.Many more!Cons:I say cons comparing it to my other VU tv which is 4k uhdPicture quality is less (obviously displays less pixels than a 4k)Can't play 4k videos online or through USB.(cos its not a 4k tv its a 2k tv), even if the video plays it won't be a 4k video.Video upscaling not good as a 4k tv.No voice assistant support on tv remote.(I hardly use it even on my 4k tv)1less hdmiportDoesn't have Features like HDR, Dolby in it.Viewing distance is more (minimum 6ft compared to my 4k which is 4ft)So that's it.. Other than above cons I don't think my 2k tv is not good as my 4k tv.This tv beats its fhd competitors one sided and is best value for money if u r buying a fhd. The settings and features found in this tv are so much customizable you can get best results in both video and audio.If uer budget is 25k+ just buy a 4k tv. The newer models of vu like premium android or the latest vu cinema will be best buys. But before buying a 4k tv just remember there is  not too much 4k content available currently. Also if 4k is 4 times clear it also is 4times bigger in file size means more data consumption and more internet speed required. All dth providers provide fhd channels or sd channels so buying 4k tv only to watch them is not worth.Hope my review helps u choose the best.
